decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - 1/ The resultant two-storey detached house, by reason of its bulk, height and excessive depth, would represent an obtrusive and un-neighbourly overdevelopment of the site, which would result in enclosure and loss of outlook to the rear of the neighbouring property, and would result in an unacceptable loss of residential amenity to the area as a whole, contrary to adopted UDP policies ENV.1.1 & H.3.4 and revised deposit UDP (January 2001) policies ENV-B.1.1 & H.6.4 and the Residential Extension Guidelines (July 2002).

Condition : 2 - 2/ The resultant two-storey detached house, would represent a bulky and incongruous development within the streetscene, which would be at odds with the scale and character of development in this residential area and would be detrimental to local visual amenity, contrary to adopted UDP policies ENV.1.1 & H.3.4 and revised deposit UDP (Jan 2001) policies ENV-B.1.1 & H.6.4 and the Residential Extension Guidelines (July 2002).
description: Erection of a first floor and a two-storey rear extension to bungalow to create a two-storey detached house with hipped roof.
